title: Using Vulnogram with CVE Services (Updated Screenshots)
sourcePdfTitle: Using Vulnogram with CVE Services Portal

sections.title: 1. Access Vulnogram
sections.text: Open Vulnogram and start in the CVE workspace. For local documentation builds, this script serves `standalone/index.html` and captures that UI.

sections.title: 2. Login to CVE Services
sections.text: Open the **CVE Portal** panel, select the target portal (`production`, `test`, `adp-test`, or local), and authenticate with your CNA short name, CVE user, and API key.

sections.title: 3. Reserve CVE IDs
sections.text: After login, use **Reserve One CVE** or the dropdown batch actions to reserve IDs for the current year, next year, or previous year. Use state/year filters to find reserved IDs.

sections.title: 4. Enter CVE Record Details
sections.text: Use the editor tab to enter vulnerability details, affected products, references, and metrics. Switch between **Editor**, **Source**, and **Preview** tabs while drafting.

sections.title: 5. Publish to CVE Services
sections.text: Use **Publish CVE** to submit the record to the currently selected portal. In test mode, publishing targets the CVE Services test environment.

sections.title: 6. Manage Users and API Keys (Admin)
sections.text: Organization administrators can open **Users** in the portal view to add users, update profile and role attributes, disable accounts, and reset API secrets.
